intro: Phlegmariurus lockyeri, commonly known as the Lockyer's haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its distinctive, elongated leaf structure with a prominent costa. The plant exhibits a dark green to reddish-brown coloration, depending on moisture levels and environmental conditions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. Phlegmariurus lockyeri plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
